rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;4dac2454.1503">   <title>Extended Call -The 8th Screenwriting Research Network (SRN) International Conference \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Deadline Monday 23rd March 2015</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;4dac2454.1503</link>   <description> The 8th Screenwriting Research Network (SRN) International Conference \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Extended Call<br><br>The deadline for abstracts is now Monday 23rd March 2015<br>The 8th Screenwriting Research Network (SRN) International Conference will take place at the University of London, UK on Thursday 10th to Saturday 12th September 2015.<br><br>It is organised by a committee grouped around the London Screenwriting Research Seminar \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd the University of Bangor, the University of East London, The University of Greenwich and Royal Holloway, University of London. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T11:11:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jill Nelmes</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;4dac2454.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;b66f07d5.1502">   <title>New Writing Viewpoints Book Series -- Wonderful Series on Creative Writing Theory & Pedagogy -- Discounted Prices! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;b66f07d5.1502</link>   <description> ?Greetings, everyone!<br><br>As a creative writer and teacher, I am very excited about the New Writing Viewpoints (NWV) Book Series. Many of these books have informed my teaching practice and changed the way I think about creative writing theory and pedagogy.<br><br>A quick description of the NWV: "New Writing Viewpoints is an exciting series from Multilingual Matters which informs teaching and research and focuses on the analysis of creative writing practice and theory. Books deal with aspects of creative writing knowledge, with issues of genre, form and style, with the nature and experience of creativity, and with the learning of [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T20:55:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Donnelly, Dianne J.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;b66f07d5.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;4954d06a.1412">   <title>Call for Critical or Creative Work - New Writing: the International Journal for the Practice and Theory of Creative Writing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;4954d06a.1412</link>   <description> Call for Critical or Creative Work<br>&quot;New Writing: the International Journal for the Practice and Theory&quot; is open for submissions for Volume 12 (Issues 12.1, 12.2 and 12.3) and Volume 13.<br>The journal considers critical work relating to Creative Writing practice and the critical examination of Creative Writing. Strong pedagogically focused papers are considered.\ufffd\ufffd<br>Creative work (in any genre) is also welcome.<br>Word length and submission guidelines at: www.newwriting.org.uk<br>Submissions welcome via this journal submission site.<br>New Writing is independent of any organisation, and is published internationally by Routledge - the world's leading academic publisher in Humanities and Social Sciences [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T12:57:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Graeme Harper</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;4954d06a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;b12a7447.1411">   <title>Neurocreator - new magazine </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;b12a7447.1411</link>   <description> *apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Hello Creators,<br><br>the inaugural edition of Neurocreator introduces a different way of looking<br>at how creators do what we do.<br><br>From the traditions of general semantics, neuro-linguistics, changework<br>therapies and the latest explorations of neuroscience comes an approach<br>that is already transforming creators' lives.<br><br>For instance, the concepts of inspiration and the muse are based on very<br>old ideas - such as the belief system of the Roman Empire and their gods!<br>Surely in the 21st Century we can get closer to the reality of the creative<br>process? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-27T13:08:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mal Williamson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;b12a7447.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;8db24bcb.1411">   <title>Call for Papers - Great Writing International Creative Writing conference, Imperial College, June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;8db24bcb.1411</link>   <description> Great Writing 2015<br><br>The 18th Annual Great Writing International\ufffd\ufffd<br>Creative Writing ConferenceImperial College LondonSat. June 20th - Sun. June 21st 2015<br>Second call (likely final call): critical or creative presentations are invited for the 18th Annual Great Writing International Creative Writing Conference.<br>In this 18th conference we look to celebrate creative writing in all its forms and to explore topics in creative writing teaching and learning. Proposals are peer reviewed. The conference also features the Annual International Creative Writing Lecture.<br>To be held at one of the UK's great universities and great locations: Imperial College London, South Kensington, a cultural [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-23T20:30:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Graeme Harper</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;8db24bcb.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;8bf73b2f.1411">   <title>CFP (deadline 15 Nov): New Generation to Next Generation 2014: Three Decades of British and Irish Poetry </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;8bf73b2f.1411</link>   <description> *New Generation to Next Generation 2014: Three Decades of British and Irish<br>Poetry, 13-14 March 2015, Institute of English Studies, London*<br><br>*Currently, poets and speakers attending the conference include: Paul<br>Farley, Patience Agbabi, Hannah Lowe, Helen Mort, and Tom Chivers<br>(publisher at Penned in the Margins).*<br>*CALL FOR PAPERS*<br><br>This two-day conference, organized by the Institute of English Studies (<br>http://www.ies.sas.ac.uk) and Oxford Brookes Poetry Centre (<br>http://www.brookes.ac.uk/poetry-centre/), addresses the three initiatives:<br>New Generation Poets (1994), Next Generation Poets (2004), and Next<br>Generation Poets 2014. It aims to examine important concerns of<br>contemporary poetry arising from these projects, such as [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-07T21:58:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Niall Munro</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;8bf73b2f.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;c0595aee.1410">   <title>Creative writing: writers on writing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;c0595aee.1410</link>   <description> Also pleased to announce that Creative Writing: Writers on Writing edited by Amal Chatterjee also out in paperback: http://creativewritingstudies.wordpress.com/creative-writing/.   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-07T10:10:10+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anthony Haynes</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;c0595aee.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;e831d65a.1410">   <title>Studying creative writing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;e831d65a.1410</link>   <description> Pleased to announce that Studying Creative Writing, edited by Sharon Norris, is now available in paperback: http://creativewritingstudies.wordpress.com/studying-creative-writing/. For once, the cliche 'by popular demand' rings true!   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-07T10:07:49+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anthony Haynes</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;e831d65a.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;32fa9cdc.1410">   <title>CfP: Wonderlands: Reading / Writing / Telling Fairy Tales and Fantasy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;32fa9cdc.1410</link>   <description> &lt;MODERN-BRITISH-FICTION@jiscmail.ac.uk&gt;<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>On 23 May 2015 the Sussex Centre for Folklore, Fairy Tales and Fantasy will<br>host a PGR Symposium entitled &quot;Wonderlands: Reading/Writing/Telling Fairy<br>Tales and Fantasy.&quot; Timed to coincide with the 150th anniversary of *Alice\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds<br>Adventures in Wonderland*, this event is primarily aimed at postgraduate<br>students and early career researchers, although other scholars and the<br>general public will be welcome. We are seeking papers which explore all<br>aspects of reading, writing, and telling fairy tales and fantasy. In<br>particular, we invite discussion of wonder lands in fantastical literature,<br>classic and modern fairy tales, and contemporary oral storytelling. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-03T13:33:54+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joanna Coleman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;32fa9cdc.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;c082d1af.1410">   <title>Ink Pantry call for submissions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;c082d1af.1410</link>   <description> Ink Pantry is a not for profit, creative writing hub run by former and<br>alumni Open University students. Our mission is to free creative writing in<br>any form from flash fiction, poetry and draft work into the ether. We have<br>published two anthologies and run a successful blog that reaches over 1,000<br>followers.<br><br>Our blog is undergoing a refresh and we are interesting in hearing from<br>potential contributors to our blog. We have a number of ways to get<br>involved: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-03T09:24:58+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Berenice Howard-Smith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;c082d1af.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;3108f508.1409">   <title>New Generation to Next Generation 2014: Three Decades of British and Irish Poetry </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;3108f508.1409</link>   <description> New Generation to Next Generation 2014: Three Decades of British and Irish Poetry<br>13-14 March 2015, Institute of English Studies, London<br><br>Call for Papers<br><br>This two-day conference, organized by the Institute of English Studies (http://www.ies.sas.ac.uk) and Oxford Brookes Poetry Centre (http://www.brookes.ac.uk/poetry-centre/), addresses the three initiatives: New Generation Poets (1994), Next Generation Poets (2004), and Next Generation Poets 2014. It aims to examine important concerns of contemporary poetry arising from these projects, such as the relationship between poetry and the public, the promotion of poetry through initiatives such as these, and what the selection of the particular poets on these lists [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-29T17:37:39+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Niall Munro</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;3108f508.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;5bf15b9e.1409">   <title>Re: Call for Papers - Great Writing 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;5bf15b9e.1409</link>   <description> Need to Contact Simon Napier about the Screenplay Masterclass. Thanks<br><br>On 22 Sep 2014, at 17:29, Graeme Harper &lt;000001b43fb15f12-dmarc-request@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; * * * CALL FOR PAPERS * * *<br>&gt; Great Writing<br>&gt; International Creative Writing Conference (UK)<br>&gt; Imperial College, London<br>&gt; Saturday 20 June \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Sunday 21 June 2015<br>&gt; Proposals are invited for the 18th Annual Great Writing International Creative Writing Conference. Creative or critical presentations are welcome.<br>> In this, the 18th year of the conference, we look to celebrate creative writing in all its forms and to explore topics in creative writing teaching and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-23T00:07:22+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>ian charles monk</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;5bf15b9e.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;aa2d75df.1409">   <title>Call for Papers - Great Writing 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;aa2d75df.1409</link>   <description> * * * CALL FOR PAPERS * * *Great Writing<br>International Creative Writing Conference (UK)Imperial College, London<br>Saturday 20 June \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Sunday 21 June 2015Proposals are invited for the 18th Annual Great Writing International Creative Writing Conference. Creative or critical presentations are welcome.In this, the 18th year of the conference, we look to celebrate creative writing in all its forms and to explore topics in creative writing teaching and learning.Proposals are peer-reviewed. The conference also features the Annual New Writing International Creative Writing Lecture.More details on the conference can be found at:\ufffd\ufffdwww.greatwriting.org.uk1. Single presentations: 20 minutes, 10 minutes questions.<br>2. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-22T16:29:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Graeme Harper</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;aa2d75df.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;3b74061f.1409">   <title>Explore FREE ACCESS to Creative Writing and Autobiography Articles! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;3b74061f.1409</link>   <description> Explore FREE ACCESS to Creative Writing and Autobiography Articles!<br><br>Dear Reader,<br><br>Delve deep into the world of creative writing and autobiography studies with this exciting FREE online article collection.&lt;http://explore.tandfonline.com/page/ah/creative-writing-autobiography&gt;<br><br>The articles included are FREE for you to read online until the end of December 2014.<br><br>To whet your appetite, here are a selection of articles: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-18T08:47:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Turner, Steven</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;3b74061f.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;57ca9547.1408">   <title>New textbook - English Language, Literature & Creative Writing: A Practical Guide for Students </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;57ca9547.1408</link>   <description> New textbook - **Apologies for cross-posting**<br><br>English Language, Literature and Creative Writing: A Practical Guide for Students Paperback \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 1 Sep 2014<br>by Sarah Dobbs (Author), Val Jessop (Author), Devon Campbell-Hall (Author), Terry McDonough (Author), Cath Nichols (Author)<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd13.99 - out 1 September.<br><br>A practical, easy-to-read guide that aims to help undergraduate students cope with the demands of English and Creative Writing degrees. Written by lecturers and industry professionals with decades of experience in professional writing and higher education, this book also includes hints and tips from previous students. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-27T15:53:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah Dobbs</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;57ca9547.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;12e7c219.1408">   <title>New Book - Screenwriters and Screenwriting: Putting Practice into Context </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;12e7c219.1408</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Apologies for cross posting - but you may be interested in this new edited<br>collection, which features some members from this network and celebrates<br>intellectual inquiry into screenwriting practice.<br><br>*Screenwriters and Screenwriting: Putting Practice into Context*, edited by<br>Craig Batty and published by Palgrave Macmillan.<br><br>An innovative, fresh and lively book that is useful for both screenwriting<br>practice and academic study. It is international in scope, with case<br>studies and analyses from the US, the UK, Australia, Japan, Ireland and<br>Denmark. The book presents a distinctive collection of chapters from<br>creative academics and critical practitioners that serve one [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-20T17:21:33+10:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Craig Batty</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;12e7c219.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;7d207a3.1408">   <title>REGISTRATION NOW OPEN: Transitions and Transgressions: 11th September 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;7d207a3.1408</link>   <description> **Registration is now open**<br><br>Transitions and Transgressions<br><br>A postgraduate and early-career researcher conference<br>Department of English and Drama, Loughborough University<br>Thursday 11th September 2014<br>Keynote speaker: Dr Pam Thurschwell (University of Sussex)<br><br>Loughborough University’s Department of English and Drama is pleased to announce that registration is now open for its inaugural conference in association with the Modern and Contemporary Research Group.<br>Transitions and Transgressions considers both literary responses to periods of historical upheaval, and literature which effects (or aims to effect) changes in cultural perspectives. Our specific focus is on ways of seeing and ways of experiencing change. (Nottingham Trent University) \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRemembrance: A Pedagogical Challenge?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-09T15:22:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nicole King</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;c6055aef.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;80a8e6b8.1407">   <title>Writing in Practice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;80a8e6b8.1407</link>   <description> Writing in Practice<br>The Journal of Creative Writing Research<br><br>NAWE's new peer-reviewed journal is currently accepting submissions for the first edition (deadline 10 July 2014). The journal aims to explore the nature of the art of writing, highlighting current academic thinking and practice, and reflecting on this with an international outlook. It will focus in particular on critical discussion of creative processes, and critical examination of the history and pedagogy of Creative Writing in all contexts. Creative work itself is welcomed when integral to an article. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-04T06:55:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nicole King</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;80a8e6b8.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;76620c01.1407">   <title>Call for Papers - 2015 Great Writing International Creative Writing Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVE-WRITING;76620c01.1407</link>   <description> Following on from a wonderful Great Writing 2014. . . \ufffd\ufffd* * * CALL FOR PAPERS * * * Great Writing UK\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds International Creative Writing Conference Imperial College, London Saturday 20 June \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Sunday 21 June 2015 Proposals are invited for the 18th Annual Great Writing International Creative Writing Conference. Creative or critical presentations are welcome. \ufffd\ufffd In this, the 18th year of the conference, we look to celebrate creative writing in all its forms and to explore topics in creative writing teaching and learning.\ufffd\ufffd Proposals are peer-reviewed. The conference also features the Annual International Creative Writing Lecture.
